name: src/behaviour/Alpha.js
Alpha
description: Behaviour that applies an alpha transition effect to particles.

name: constructor
description: Constructs an Alpha behaviour instance.

params.name: easing
params.description: The easing equation to use for transforms

params.name: isEnabled
params.description: Determines if the behaviour will be applied or not

name: alphaA
description: The starting alpha value

name: alphaB
description: The ending alpha value

name: same
description: Gets the _same property which determines if the alpha are the same.

name: same
description: Sets the _same property which determines if the alpha are the same.

name: reset
description: Resets the behaviour properties.

params.name: easing
params.description: the easing equation to use for transforms

name: initialize
description: Initializes the behaviour on a particle.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to initialize the behaviour on

name: mutate
description: Mutates the target's alpha/opacity property.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to apply the behaviour to

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a Body initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from.

properties.name: json.easing
properties.description: The easing equation to use for transforms

Attraction

params.description: The position the particles will be attracted to

name: targetPosition
description: The position the particles will be attracted to

name: radius
description: The attraction radius

name: force
description: The attraction force scalar multiplier

name: radiusSq
description: The radius of the attraction squared

name: attractionForce
description: The attraction force in 3D space

name: lengthSq
description: The linear attraction force

name: reset
description: Resets the behaviour properties.

params.name: targetPosition
params.description: the position the particles will be attracted to

name: mutate
description: Mutates particle acceleration.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to apply the behaviour to

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a Body initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from.

name: src/behaviour/Behaviour.js
Behaviour
description:
The base behaviour class.
Behaviours manage a particle's behaviour after they have been emitted.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Behaviour instance.

params.name: isEnabled
params.description: Determines if the behaviour will be applied or not

name: type
description: The class type.

name: isEnabled
description: Determines if the behaviour will be applied or not

name: id
description: The behaviour's id

name: life
description: The life of the behaviour

name: easing
description: The behaviour's decaying trend

name: age
description: The age of the behaviour

name: energy
description: The energy of the behaviour

name: dead
description: Determines if the behaviour is dead or not

name: reset
description: Reset this behaviour's parameters

name: normalizeForce
description: Normalize a force by 1:100;

name: normalizeValue
description: Normalize a value by 1:100;

name: initialize
description: Set the behaviour's initial properties on the particle.

name: applyBehaviour
description:
Apply behaviour to the target as a factor of time.
Internally calls the mutate method to change properties on the target
Will not do so if the behaviour is disabled

params.name: target
params.description: The particle or emitter to apply the behaviour to

name: mutate
description: Change the target's properties according to specific behaviour logic.

params.name: target
params.description: The particle or emitter to apply the behaviour to

name: energize
description:
Compares the age of the behaviour vs integration time and determines
if the behaviour should be set to dead or not.
Sets the behaviour energy as a factor of particle age and life.

params.name: particle
params.description: The particle to apply the behaviour to

name: destroy
description: Destory this behaviour.

name: fromJSON
description: Returns a new instance of the behaviour from the JSON object passed.

params.name: json
params.description: JSON object containing the required constructor properties

name: src/behaviour/Collision.js
Collision
description: Behaviour that causes particles to move away from other particles they collide with.

params.name: emitter

params.name: useMass
params.description: Determiens whether to use mass or not

params.name: onCollide

params.name: isEnabled
params.description: Determines if the behaviour will be applied or not

name: reset
description: Resets the behaviour properties.

params.name: emitter
params.description: The emitter containing the particles to detect collisions against

params.name: useMass
params.description: Determiens whether to use mass or not

params.name: onCollide
params.description: Function to call when particles collide

name: mutate
description:
Detects collisions with other particles and calls the
onCollide function on colliding particles.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to apply the behaviour to

name: _getAverageMass
description: Gets the average mass of both particles.

Rotate
description: Behaviour that rotates particles.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Rotate behaviour instance.

params.name: easing
params.description: The easing equation to use for transforms

params.name: isEnabled
params.description: Determines if the behaviour will be applied or not

name: rotationType
description: Gets the rotation type.

name: rotationType
description: Sets the rotation type.

name: _rotationType
description: The rotation type. ENUM of ['same', 'set', 'to', 'add'].

name: reset
description: Resets the behaviour properties.

params.name: easing
params.description: the easing equation to use for transforms

name: x
description: X axis rotation.

name: y
description: Y axis rotation.

name: z
description: Z axis rotation.

name: initialize
description: Initializes the behaviour on a particle.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to initialize the behaviour on

name: _setRotation
description:
Sets the particle's rotation prior to the behaviour being applied.

NOTE It's hard to see here, but this is mutating the particle's rotation
even though the particle is not being passed in directly.

NOTE the else if below will never be reached because the value being passed in
will never be of type Vector3D.

params.name: value
params.description:
the value to set the rotation value to, if 'random'
rotation is randomised

name: mutate
description: Mutates the particle.rotation property.

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to apply the behaviour to

name: src/core/Particle.js
Particle
description: A Particle is an object that is emitted by an emitter.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Particle instance.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to instantiate the particle with

properties.name: properties.dead
properties.description: Determines if the particle is dead or not

properties.name: properties.sleep
properties.description: Determines if the particle is sleeping or not

name: id
description: The particle's unique id

name: type
description: The class type.

name: life
description: The particle's life

name: age
description: The particle's age

name: energy
description: The particle's energy loss

name: dead
description: Determines if the particle is dead or not

name: sleep
description: Determines if the particle is sleeping or not

name: body
description: The particle's body

name: parent
description: The particle's parent

name: mass
description: The particle's mass

name: radius
description: The particle's radius

name: alpha
description: The particle's alpha

name: scale
description: The particle's scale

name: useColor
description: Determines whether to use color or not

name: useAlpha
description: Determines whether to use alpha or not

name: easing
description: The particle's easing

name: position
description: The particle's position

name: velocity
description: The particle's velocity

name: acceleration
description: The particle's acceleration

name: old
description: The particle's last position, velocity and acceleration

name: behaviours
description: The particle's behaviours array

name: transform
description: The particle's transform collection

name: color
description: The particle's color store

name: rotation
description: The particle's rotation

name: getDirection
description: Gets the particle's current direction.

name: reset
description:
Resets the particle's default properties and clear's its particle's position,
velocity, acceleration, color and rotation. Also destroy's the particle's
transform collection & removes all behaviours.

name: update
description:
Updates the particle's properties by applying each behaviour to the particle.
Will also update the particle's energy, unless it's age is greater than it's life
in which case it will be destroyed.

name: addBehaviour
description: Adds a behaviour to the particle.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to add to the particle

name: addBehaviours
description: Adds multiple behaviours to the particle.

params.name: behaviours
params.description: An array of behaviours to add to the particle

name: removeBehaviour
description: Removes the behaviour from the particle.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to remove from the particle

name: removeAllBehaviours
description: Removes all behaviours from the particle.

name: destroy
description: Destroys the particle.

name: src/core/Pool.js
Pool
description:
An object pool implementation. Used for pooling objects to avoid unnecessary
garbage collection.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Pool instance.

name: type
description: The class type.

name: cID
description: Incrementing id that keeps a count of the number of objects created

name: list
description: Map of pools in the format of PUID<String>: pool<Array>

name: create
description:
Attempts to create a new object either by creating a new instance or calling its
clone method.

params.name: functionOrObject
params.description: The object to instantiate or clone

name: canInstantiateObject
description: Determines if the object is able to be instantiated or not.

name: canCloneObject
description: Determines if the object is able to be cloned or not.

name: canCreateNewObject
description: Determines if a new object is able to be created.

name: getCount
description: Gets a count of all objects in the pool.

name: get
description: Gets an object either by creating a new one or retrieving it from the pool.

params.name: obj
params.description: The function or object to get

name: expire
description: Pushes an object into the pool.

name: destroy
description: Destroys all pools.

name: _getList
description: Gets the pool mapped to the UID.

name: src/core/System.js
System
description:
The core of the three-system particle engine.
A System instance can contain multiple emitters, each with their own initializers
and behaviours.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a System instance.

params.name: preParticles
params.description: The number of particles to start with

name: type
description: The class type.

name: canUpdate
description:
Determines if the system can update or not. Set to false when destroying
to ensure that external calls to update do not throw errors.

name: preParticles
description: The number of particles to start with.

name: integrationType
description: The integration algorithm type to use.

name: emitters
description: The emitters in the particle system.

name: renderers
description: The renderers for the system.

name: pool
description: A pool used to manage the internal system cache of objects

name: eventDispatcher
description: Internal event dispatcher

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a System instance from a JSON object.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to create the System instance from

params.name: THREE
params.description: The Web GL Api to use eg., THREE

name: fromJSONAsync
description:
Loads a System instance from JSON asynchronously. Ensures all textures are
fully loaded before resolving with the instantiated System instance.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to create the System instance from

params.name: THREE
params.description: The Web GL Api to use eg., THREE

name: dispatch
description: Proxy method for the internal event dispatcher's dispatchEvent method.

name: addRenderer
description: Adds a renderer to the System instance and initializes it.

name: removeRenderer
description: Removes a renderer from the System instance.

name: addEmitter
description:
Adds an emitter to the System instance.
Dispatches the EMITTER_ADDED event.

name: removeEmitter
description:
Removes an emitter from the System instance.
Dispatches the EMITTER_REMOVED event.

name: update
description: Updates the particle system based on the delta passed.

name: getCount
description: Gets a count of the total number of particles in the system.

name: destroy
description:
Destroys all emitters and the Proton pool.
Ensures that this.update will not perform any operations while the system
is being destroyed.

content:
const isBrowser = typeof window !== 'undefined' ? true : false;
const THREE = isBrowser && window.THREE ? window.THREE : require('three');

export const {
  BoxGeometry,
  Euler,
  Geometry,
  Mesh,
  MeshBasicMaterial,
  MeshLambertMaterial,
  OctahedronGeometry,
  SphereGeometry,
  Sprite,
  SpriteMaterial,
  Texture,
  TextureLoader,
  Vector3,
  AdditiveBlending,
  CustomBlending,
  MultiplyBlending,
  NoBlending,
  NormalBlending,
  SubtractiveBlending,
} = THREE;

name: src/debug/log.js
log
description:
You can use this emit particles.

This method will console.log the fixed number of your info  in updata or requestAnimationFrame

use like this log('+12',mc); log 12 times

name: src/ease/index.js
ease
description: The Ease class provides a collection of easing functions for use with System

name: src/emitter/Emitter.js
Emitter
description:
Emitters are the System engine's particle factories. They cause particles to
be rendered by emitting them, and store all particle initializers and behaviours.

name: constructor
description: Constructs an Emitter instance.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to instantiate the emitter with

name: type
description: The class type.

name: particles
description: The particles emitted by this emitter.

name: initializers
description: The initializers for particles emitted by this emitter.

name: behaviours
description: The behaviours for particles emitted by this emitter.

name: emitterBehaviours
description: The behaviours for the emitter.

name: currentEmitTime
description: The current emit iteration.

name: totalEmitTimes
description: The total number of times the emitter should emit particles.

name: damping
description: The friction coefficient for all particle to emit by.

name: bindEmitter
description:
Ensures that particles emitted by this emitter are positioned
according to the emitter's properties.

name: bindEmitterEvent
description:
Determines if the emitter will dispatch internal events. Defaults
to false

name: rate
description: The number of particles to emit per second (a [particle]/b [s])

name: id
description: The emitter's id.

name: eventDispatcher
description: The emitter's internal event dispatcher.

name: dispatch
description: Proxy method for the internal event dispatcher's dispatchEvent method.

name: setRate
description: Sets the emitter rate.

name: setPosition
description: Sets the position of the emitter.

params.name: newPosition
params.description: an object the new x, y and z props

name: setRotation
description: Sets the rotation of the emitter.

params.name: newRotation
params.description: an object the new x, y and z props

name: emit
description:
Sets the total number of times the emitter should emit particles as well as
the emitter's life. Also intializes the emitter rate.
This enables the emitter to emit particles.

params.name: totalEmitTimes
params.description: the total number of times to emit particles

params.name: life
params.description: the life of this emitter in milliseconds

name: stopEmit
description: Stops the emitter from emitting particles.

name: removeAllParticles
description: Kills all of the emitter's particles.

name: addInitializer
description:
Adds a particle initializer to the emitter.
Each initializer is run on each particle when they are created.

name: addInitializers
description: Adds multiple particle initializers to the emitter.

name: setInitializers
description: Sets the emitter's particle initializers.

name: removeInitializer
description: Removes an initializer from the emitter's initializers array.

name: removeAllInitializers
description: Removes all initializers.

name: addBehaviour
description:
Adds a behaviour to the emitter. All emitter behaviours are added to each particle when
they are emitted.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to add to the emitter

name: addBehaviours
description: Adds multiple behaviours to the emitter.

name: setBehaviours
description: Sets the emitter's behaviours.

name: removeBehaviour
description: Removes the behaviour from the emitter's behaviours array.

name: removeAllBehaviours
description: Removes all behaviours from the emitter.

name: addEmitterBehaviour
description: Adds an emitter behaviour to the emitter.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to add to the emitter

name: addEmitterBehaviours
description: Adds multiple behaviours to the emitter.

name: setEmitterBehaviours
description: Sets the emitter's behaviours.

name: removeEmitterBehaviour
description: Removes the behaviour from the emitter's behaviours array.

name: removeAllEmitterBehaviours
description: Removes all behaviours from the emitter.

name: createParticle
description:
Creates a particle by retreiving one from the pool and setting it up with
the supplied initializer and behaviour.

name: setupParticle
description:
Sets up a particle by running all initializers on it and setting its behaviours.
Also adds the particle to this.particles.

name: update
description:
Updates the emitter according to the time passed by calling the generate
and integrate methods. The generate method creates particles, the integrate
method updates existing particles.

If the emitter age is greater than time, the emitter is killed.

name: updateEmitterBehaviours
description: Updates the emitter's emitter behaviours.

name: integrate
description:
Runs the integration algorithm on the emitter and all particles.
Updates the particles with the timstamp passed.

name: generate
description: Generates new particles.

name: destroy
description: Kills the emitter.

name: src/emitter/FollowEmitter.js
constructor
description:
The FollowEmitter class inherits from System.Emitter

use the FollowEmitter will emit particle when mousemoving

name: type
description: The class type.

name: emit
description: start emit particle

name: stopEmit
description: stop emiting

name: destroy
description: Destory this Emitter

name: src/emitter/constants.js
src/emitter/index.js
content:
export { default as FollowEmitter } from './FollowEmitter';
export { default as Emitter } from './Emitter';

name: src/emitter/types.js
content:
export const EMITTER_TYPE_EMITTER = 'Emitter';
export const EMITTER_TYPE_FOLLOW = 'FollowEmitter';

src/initializer/Body.js
Body
description: Sets the body property on initialized particles.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Body initalizer instance.

params.name: body
params.description:
The content for the particle body, can
be a color or an object (mesh)

params.name: w
params.description: The width of the particle body

params.name: h
params.description: The height of the particle body

name: body
description: The content for the particle body

name: w
description: The width of the particle Body

name: h
description: The height of the particle Body

name: src/initializer/BodySprite.js
BodySprite
description:
Sets the body property to be a THREE.Sprite on initialized particles.

NOTE The texture map MUST be set on the SpriteMaterial in the TextureLoader.load
callback. Not doing so will cause WebGL buffer errors.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a BodySprite initializer.

params.name: THREE
params.description: The Web GL API we are using eg., THREE

throws.description: If the TextureLoader fails to load the supplied texture

name: materialProperties
description:
The material properties for this object's SpriteMaterial
NOTE This is required for testing purposes

name: texture
description: The texture for the THREE.SpriteMaterial map.

name: material
description: THREE.SpriteMaterial instance.

name: sprite
description: THREE.Sprite instance.

name: initialize
description: Sets the particle body to the sprite.

params.name: particle
params.description: The particle to set the body of

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a BodySprite initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from

params.name: THREE
params.description: The Web GL API we are using eg., THREE

name: src/initializer/Initializer.js
Initializer
description: The base Emitter / Particle property class.

name: constructor
description: Constructs an Initializer instance.

params.name: isEnabled
params.description: Determines if the initializer should be enabled or not

name: init
description: Initializes the property on the emitter or particle.

params.name: emitter
params.description: the emitter to initialize the property on

params.name: particle
params.description: the particle to intiialize the property on

name: initialize
description: Place custom property initialization code in this method in the subclass.

params.name: target
params.description: either an Emitter or a Particle

name: requiresWebGlApi
description:
Determines if the initializer requires a Web GL API to be provided to its constructor.
If true, the WebGL API will need to be provided as the first argument to the constructor
and fromJSON methods.

name: fromJSON
description: Returns a new instance of the initializer from the JSON object passed.

params.name: json
params.description: JSON object containing the required constructor properties

Life

name: src/initializer/Position.js
Position
description:
Sets the starting position property for initialized particles.
This is derived from a zone randomly chosen from those supplied to the constructor.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Position initializer instance.

name: reset
description:
Resets the initializer properties.
Clears all previously set zones and resets the zones according to args passed.

description: Adds a zone or zones to this.zones.

description: Creates a Position initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from.

params.description: The type of zone to use for initial position

name: src/initializer/Rate.js
Rate
description:
Calculates the rate of particle emission.

NOTE This doesn't need to be an initializer, it doesn't have an initialize
method, it overrides the base init method and it is only relevent to the Emitter class.
It would be better to move this to the Emitter module itself as a standalone class.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Rate instance.

params.name: numPan
params.description: The number of particles to emit

params.name: timePan
params.description: The time between each particle emission

name: numPan
description: Sets the number of particles to emit.

name: timePan
description: Sets the time between each particle emission.

name: startTime
description: The rate's start time.

name: nextTime
description: The rate's next time.

name: init
description: Sets the startTime and nextTime properties.

name: getValue
description: Gets the number of particles to emit.

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a Rate initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from.

properties.name: json.particlesMin
properties.description: The minimum number of particles to emit

properties.name: json.particlesMax
properties.description: The maximum number of particles to emit

properties.name: json.perSecondMin
properties.description: The minimum per second emit rate

properties.name: json.perSecondMax
properties.description: The maximum per second emit rate

import uid from 'uuid/v1';

export default uid;

name: src/zone/BoxZone.js
constructor
description: BoxZone is a box zone

params.name: x
params.description: the position's x value or a Vector3D Object

name: isBoxZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a BoxZone.

name: src/zone/LineZone.js
constructor
description: LineZone is a 3d line zone

params.name: x1
params.description: the line's start point of x value or a Vector3D Object

params.name: y1
params.description: the line's start point of y value or a Vector3D Object

params.name: z1
params.description: the line's start point of z value

params.name: x2
params.description: the line's end point of x value

params.name: y2
params.description: the line's end point of y value

params.name: z2
params.description: the line's end point of z value

name: isLineZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a LineZone.

name: src/zone/MeshZone.js
MeshZone
description: Uses a three THREE.Geometry to determine the zone parameters.

params.name: bounds
params.description: the geometry or mesh that will determine the zone bounds

name: isMeshZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a MeshZone.

name: src/zone/PointZone.js
constructor
description: PointZone is a point zone

params.name: x
params.description: the center's x value or a Vector3D Object

name: isPointZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a PointZone.

name: src/zone/ScreenZone.js
constructor
description: ScreenZone is a 3d line zone

params.name: x1
params.description: the line's start point of x value or a Vector3D Object

params.name: y1
params.description: the line's start point of y value or a Vector3D Object

params.name: z1
params.description: the line's start point of z value

params.name: x2
params.description: the line's end point of x value

params.name: y2
params.description: the line's end point of y value

params.name: z2
params.description: the line's end point of z value

name: isScreenZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a ScreenZone.

name: src/zone/SphereZone.js
SphereZone
description: A spherical zone for particles to be emitted within.

name: isSphereZone
description: Returns true to indicate this is a SphereZone.

name: _dead
description: Sets the particle to dead if the particle collides with the sphere.

name: _cross
description: Warns that this zone does not support the _cross method.

name: src/zone/Zone.js
Zone
description:
A Zone determines the area in 3D space where an emitter's particles can position
themselves. They are supplied to both the Position initializer
and the CrossZone behaviour.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Zone instance.

name: isBoxZone
description: Determines if this zone is a BoxZone.

name: isLineZone
description: Determines if this zone is a LineZone.

name: isMeshZone
description: Determines if this zone is a MeshZone.

name: isPointZone
description: Determines if this zone is a PointZone.

name: isScreenZone
description: Determines if this zone is a ScreenZone.

name: isSphereZone
description: Determines if this zone is a SphereZone.

name: _dead
description: Sets the particle's dead property to true if required.

name: src/zone/index.js
src/zone/types.js
./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "three-nebula",
  "version": "5.0.0-alpha",
  "description": "WebGL based 3D particle engine",
  "main": "./build/three-nebula.js",
  "directories": {
    "docs": "docs"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "build": "webpack && npm run docs:build",
    "docs": "./scripts/docs",
    "docs:build": "./scripts/docs-build",
    "test": "mocha --require @babel/register --colors './test/**/*.spec.js'",
    "test:only": "mocha --require @babel/register --colors",
    "test:watch": "mocha --require @babel/register --colors -w './test/**/*.spec.js'",
    "test:watch-only": "mocha --require @babel/register --colors -w ",
    "lint": "eslint src test && ./node_modules/.bin/madge --circular src",
    "lint:fix": "eslint --fix",
    "coverage:view": "open ./coverage/lcov-report/index.html",
    "coverage:generate": "istanbul cover -x 'src/core/three/*.js' -x 'src/debug/*.js' ./node_modules/.bin/_mocha './test/**/*.spec.js' -- --require @babel/register",
    "coverage:publish": "cat ./coverage/lcov.info | ./node_modules/.bin/coveralls",
    "git:publish": "./scripts/publish"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "particle",
    "three.js",
    "3d"
  ],
  "authors": [
    "a-jie",
    "rohan-deshpande"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula#readme",
  "dependencies": {
    "lodash": "^4.17.11",
    "uuid": "^3.3.2"
  },
  "peerDependencies": {
    "three": "^0.106.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.5.0",
    "@babel/core": "^7.5.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread": "^7.5.1",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.5.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.5.0",
    "@babel/register": "^7.4.4",
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.5.1",
    "babel-eslint": "^7.2.1",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.6",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "coveralls": "^3.0.3",
    "domino": "^2.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^6.0.1",
    "eslint-loader": "^2.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.18.0",
    "http-server": "^0.11.1",
    "istanbul": "^1.1.0-alpha.1",
    "madge": "^3.3.0",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "prettier": "^1.16.4",
    "sinon": "^7.1.1",
    "stats.js": "^0.17.0",
    "three": "^0.106.1",
    "webpack": "^4.35.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.5"
  }
}
name: package.json
